title: 2-Server PIR with Sub-polynomial Communication
description: Zeev Dvir, Sivakanth Gopi, "2-server PIR with subpolynomial communication." Journal of the ACM (JACM), 2016 and winner of STOC 2015 Best Paper Award. See [link](https://youtu.be/iXBncrIlMco?si=HB17qDDm9-8NpKP2) for a longer version given by Zeev.

title: CSPs with Global Modular Constraints
description: Joshua Brakensiek, Sivakanth Gopi, Venkatesan Guruswami, "CSPs with global modular constraints: algorithms and hardness via polynomial representations," STOC 2019.

title: Higher Order MDS Codes
description: Joshua Brakensiek, Sivakanth Gopi, Visu Makam, "Generic reed-solomon codes achieve list-decoding capacity", STOC 2023. Joshua Brakensiek, Manik Dhar, Sivakanth Gopi, "Generalized GM-MDS: Polynomial Codes are Higher Order MDS", STOC 2024. Joshua Brakensiek, Manik Dhar, Sivakanth Gopi, Zihan Zhang, "AG codes achieve list decoding capacity over constant-sized fields", STOC 2024.

title: Spanoids - An Abstraction of Spanning Structures, and a Barrier for LCCs
description: Zeev Dvir, Sivakanth Gopi, Yuzhou Gu, Avi Wigderson, "Spanoids---An Abstraction of Spanning Structures, and a Barrier for LCCs." SIAM Journal on Computing, 2020.

title: Private Convex Optimization via Exponential Mechanism
description: Sivakanth Gopi, Yin Lee, Daogao Liu, "Private convex optimization via exponential mechanism", COLT 2022.

title: Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning
description: A general audience talk on privacy preserving machine learning, specifically on differentially private deep learning.

title: Differentially Private Synthetic Data via Foundation Model APIs
description: Zinan Lin, Sivakanth Gopi, Janardhan Kulkarni, Harsha Nori, Sergey Yekhanin, "Differentially private synthetic data via foundation model apis 1: Images", ICLR 2024.

title: Fast and Memory Efficient Differentially Private-SGD via JL Projections
description: Zhiqi Bu, Sivakanth Gopi, Janardhan Kulkarni, Yin Lee, Hanwen Shen, Uthaipon Tantipongpipat, "Fast and memory efficient differentially private-sgd via jl projections", NeurIPS 2021.

title: Maximally Recoverable Local Reconstruction Codes
description: Sivakanth Gopi, Venkatesan Guruswami, Sergey Yekhanin, "Maximally recoverable LRCs: A field size lower bound and constructions for few heavy parities", IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, 2020.
